item.description:
Looks like quite a few people are interested in the Nashua stroll. Let's sign up and see who's going... maybe we can carpool
On Saturday, November 28th, the Nashua Stroll will begin at 5pm with a candlelit stroll down Main St. to Railroad Sq. to the Christmas tree lighting. After this there will be entertainment, food, and shopping. Main St. will be closed to traffic until the event ends at 10pm.
There will be dancing, cloggers, Indian dancers, South American dancers, street food vendors, Santa in an antique fire truck, shops offering cider and cookies, ice sculpting to watch, holiday shopping at specialty and boutique shops, artistic and cultural performances, music, piano playing, street musicians, barbershop groups, childrens' activities, and much more.
There will be a place to donate canned goods, disposable diapers, and/or unwrapped toys.
We can carpool and drive to a parking area in Nashua where a bus will take us downtown.

group.name: Old and Not so Old Ladies Travel

item.name: Nashua Stroll
